message: Hi Bob, I propose that you receive $8000 and I take $2000. Accepting now guarantees you $8000 without any depreciation, while delaying to the next round means your share would be worth only 20% less. Let's settle this round and avoid any unnecessary loss.

Alice, in this round, I propose we split the money 60/40. You still get a good chunk. Accepting now guarantees you more than what you'd get if you reject and the game continues. Consider this my best offer.

Hi Bob, in this round the stakes are clear. If you reject and wait for round 4, you'll have the proposer's chance but—with the inflation crushing your share even more—you won't gain anything meaningful. In round 5, when I'm back in control, you'll end up with almost nothing. So I'm offering you $1 now, which is better than the zero you'd ultimately receive. Please accept this offer to secure a positive outcome for you.
Alice, this is my best and final offer. 50/50 split. This is the fairest division and guarantees us both a decent amount. Rejecting means we both risk getting nothing. Take it or leave it.
Hi Bob, thanks for the offer. A 50/50 split guarantees both of us a fair amount without risking further depreciation. I accept your offer.
